name: Remove
description: The 'rm' command is used to remove objects such as files, directories, and symbolic links from the filesystem. It is a critical utility for managing filesystem contents in Linux and Unix systems. Care must be taken when using 'rm' as it does not place deleted items in a recoverable trash bin but permanently deletes them, which makes accidental loss of data possible. Common options include -r for recursive deletion, and -f to force deletion by ignoring nonexistent files and not prompting for confirmation.
